parts: what is taas?
Taas is Thapar Amateur Astronomy Society
what is taas?

Thapar Amateur Astronomy Society (TAAS) is a student-run astronomy club at Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology in Patiala, India. It was founded in 2008 with the aim of promoting astronomy and space science among students and the general public. TAAS organizes various events and activities throughout the year, including:

* **Observing sessions:** TAAS members regularly conduct observing sessions using the club's telescopes. These sessions are open to all students and members of the public, and provide an opportunity to view celestial objects such as planets, stars, nebulae, and galaxies.

* **Lectures and workshops:** TAAS invites guest speakers from various fields of astronomy and space science to give lectures and conduct workshops for its members. These events provide an opportunity for students to learn about the latest research and developments in astronomy and space exploration.

* **Public outreach events:** TAAS organizes public outreach events such as star parties and astronomy exhibitions. These events are designed to educate the general public about astronomy and space science, and to generate interest in these fields.

* **Competitions:** TAAS organizes various competitions for its members, such as astrophotography competitions and quiz competitions. These competitions provide an opportunity for students to showcase their skills and knowledge in astronomy and space science.

TAAS is a vibrant and active club that provides a platform for students to explore their passion for astronomy and space science. The club also plays an important role in promoting astronomy and space science among the general public.
what    are some event name that taas does every year

Some of the annual events organized by Thapar Amateur Astronomy Society (TAAS) include:

* **Astrophotography Competition:** TAAS holds an annual astrophotography competition where members submit their best astrophotography images. The competition is judged by a panel of experts, and prizes are awarded to the winners.

* **Astronomy Quiz Competition:** TAAS organizes an annual astronomy quiz competition where teams of students compete against each other to answer questions about astronomy and space science.

* **Star Party:** TAAS hosts an annual star party, which is open to the public. The star party provides an opportunity for people to view celestial objects through telescopes and learn about astronomy from TAAS members.

* **Astronomy Awareness Week:** TAAS organizes an annual Astronomy Awareness Week, which includes a series of events and activities designed to promote astronomy and space science among students and the general public. These events may include lectures, workshops, observing sessions, and public outreach events.

* **Guest Lectures:** TAAS invites guest speakers from various fields of astronomy and space science to give lectures for its members and the general public. These lectures provide an opportunity to learn about the latest research and developments in astronomy and space exploration.

* **Observing Sessions:** TAAS members regularly conduct observing sessions using the club's telescopes. These sessions are open to all students and members of the public, and provide an opportunity to view celestial objects such as planets, stars, nebulae, and galaxies.

In addition to these annual events, TAAS also organizes other events and activities throughout the year, such as workshops, field trips, and collaborations with other astronomy clubs and organizations.
who is the gensec of society

The General Secretary (GenSec) of Thapar Amateur Astronomy Society (TAAS) is **Mr. Hrsh Dhingra**. He is a third year undergraduate student in the Department of Computer Engineering at Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology. Hrsh has been an active member of TAAS since his first year of college, and has served in various leadership positions within the club. He is passionate about astronomy and space science, and is committed to promoting these fields among students and the general public. As the GenSec of TAAS, Hrsh is responsible for managing the day-to-day affairs of the club. He works closely with the President and other office bearers to plan and organize events and activities. Himanshu is also responsible for maintaining communication with the members of TAAS and ensuring that the club runs smoothly. Hrsh is a dedicated and hardworking individual, and he is committed to making TAAS a vibrant and active club. He is always looking for new ways to engage students and the general public in astronomy and space science. Under Hrsh's leadership, TAAS has organized a number of successful events and activities, including observing sessions, guest lectures, workshops, and public outreach events. TAAS has also collaborated with other astronomy clubs and organizations to promote astronomy and space science in the region.
eb members of taas?

The EB members of Thapar Amateur Astronomy Society (TAAS) are the Executive Body members of the club. The EB members are responsible for the overall functioning of the club and for planning and organizing events and activities. The EB members are elected annually by the members of TAAS from among its active members. The EB members of TAAS for the academic year 2022-2023 are: 1. Hrsh Dhingra (General Secretary)

Eureka 7.0

Description: TAAS’s annual week-long flagship event for college students that
gears up for informative and interesting guest lectures, revolving around
Rad@home.
Tentative dates: last or 2nd last week of February, 2024
Details:
● Pre-Events (2-3 days): Scavenger hunt, Group Discussion, Quizzes,
Experimental activities.
● Main Event: Guest Lecture by Researcher/Professor from renown Institute
in India.
● Rad@Home Workshop (characterized below)
Rad@Home

Description: RAD@home is a citizen-science research platform in astronomy
wherein any B.Sc./B.E.(Undergraduate/Graduate students and citizens) can do
multiwavelength, extragalactic Astronomy research (ABCD research) by utilizing
the power of the internet. “ABCD research stands for Any B.Sc./B.E. Can Do
research” using GMRT sitting ‘@home’ anywhere in India by joining
RAD@Home which practices a novel approach of training the students to get
them ready for the research.
Tentative Dates: last or 2nd last week of February, 2024
Details:
● 2-day online workshop taken by a Researcher/Professor from RAD@Home
organization
● Topics covered in the workshop include utilizing RGB-contour
multi-wavelength galaxy image analysis to gain insights into the structure,
properties and composition of galaxies.
Telescope Setups

Description: Weekly telescope setups at various places sprawling across the
campus; open for all students. These setups provide an enjoyable and immersive
introduction to astronomy, enabling students to experience the pleasures of
stargazing and astrophotography.
Dates: depending on lunar phase and notable sightings
Details: Observing planets, moon and stars under the dark sky through an
Astronomical Telescope
Intra-Society group discussions

Description: Weekly group discussions for society members to gather and delve
into the fascinating realms of astronomy and astrophysics. Aim of these
discussions is to fuel passion, expand knowledge, and foster a sense of community
among members. Furthermore, it increases the speaking skills as well as awareness
about current affairs in astronomy.
Dates: Every week at Friday, 5:30PM
Details:
● Weekly themed group discussions on astronomy and astrophysics for
society members
what is eureka 5.0

TAAS brings to you Eureka 5.0 - Lecture Symposium!
Our upcoming annual event Eureka 5.0, a daylong lecture symposium in which some of the most renowned professors of our country are invited as speakers, is scheduled for Sunday, 5th December 2021, from 10:00 AM to 3:00 PM. This year's theme is "Gravitational waves, its detection with emphasis on LIGO India Project".
Scan the QR code to register, or click on this link https://bit.ly/eureka5_lectures
Find out more about us at https://linktr.ee/taas
For any queries, write to us at - 
taas.astronomers@thapar.edu
RAD@home

Have you ever wondered how you can quench your thirst for astronomy and science other than just plain old stargazing? Worry not, for we, along with RAD@home, have brought for you a fun and interesting astronomy workshop that will help you participate in this amazing journey that humankind is making towards the expanse of the cosmos, right from the comfort of your homes. There is no participation fee for this event. #RADatThaparInstitute
RAD@home is a nationwide Inter-University Collaboratory of hundreds of trained citizen scientists, dozen professional astronomers and is supported by over two dozen research and educational institutes all over India. We have invited RAD@home to take a session on GMRT-RAD@home Citizen Science Research in Astronomy.
You will learn to:-
Make UV-Optical-IR-radio images of astronomical objects using #RADatHomeIndia RGB-maker, a free online tool, Analyse multi-wavelength galaxy images having actively accreting supermassive black holes and much more!
Three mini lectures will be organised before the main event, and we will be joined by Ananda Hota Sir and @ Mamta Gulati Bansal Ma'am.
Register through https://bit.ly/TAAS_workshop
Zoom link will be provided through email.
Refer to the poster for more details.
RADatHome, India for Citizen-Science research in Astronomy
Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology
Tell me about eureka 4.0?

This year has been rough for all, but TAAS surely ended it with a bang.
We at TAAS are happy to announce that after a lot of hustle, Eureka 4.0 was successfully concluded on 22nd November, 2020.
The main event was preluded by a General Astronomy Quiz, which was conducted on 7th November, 2020. The quiz was followed by Astroreilis on the next day. 
This was just the first half of the precursor events. 
Astroreilis was followed by Astromemia, a astronomy based meme competition. A day after astromemia, De-Sci-Pher, a Capture the Flag event was conducted. 
And then the main event day was on 22nd November, 2020 for our Annual flagship event Eureka 4.0
We were joined by esteemed scientists and professors from renowned institutions of India who delivered lectures on various aspects of Spectroscopy. The lecture session was followed by a panel discussion with the guests.
Eureka 4.0 was successfully concluded with a huge crowd of participants from various regions of the country. 
We thank all the participants who enthusiastically became a part of these events. 
But wait, our events aren't just over yet, TAAS still has a lot of things planned for you. Stay tuned for more updates regarding Group Discussions, Quizzes and what not.
What is Astronemia?

We look at the sky and ponder how huge the universe is, second only to Joe's mama, and it is almost depressing how little we are compared to it. All we need is a pinch of humor to cheer up.
Just to work that out, Thapar Amateur Astronomers Society is back with Astromemia for all those folks who think can create humor out of astronomy and make the neanderthals chuckle.
Send your astronomy/science memes to us. The best memes will be featured on our Instagram (top 5) and the winners will be given a special prize.✨
Exciting prizes await!!
Scan the QR code or click here http://bit.ly/taas_astromemia to fill your entries.
eureka 3.0

*January 19, 2020*

LP-101, new CSED Block, Thapar Institute, Patiala

What is Astronemia 2.0?

The Universe is a dark place, so why not use it to create some 'dark' astro-humour
We bring back ASTROMEMIA for all those who have that funny bone and think that they can make people laugh with their astronomy jokes.
Send your astronomy/science memes to us. All of them will be posted on our TAAS Facebook page. The best memes will be featured on our Instagram (top 5) and the winners will be given a special prize. 
Are you ready?
*Rulebook for Participation*
1. Theme - As the name signifies, all the entries must be related to astronomy, related news and related sciences. Posting will be at the sole discretion of TAAS team. You will be informed if your entry is rejected.
2. Multiple entries by one person are PERMITTED.
3. Content must be ORIGINAL. Plagiarism will not be tolerated and if found, all the entries of the person will be removed. Likewise, the content needs to be universal and you hence no vulgar or demeaning entries will be posted. 
4. Participants are free to use meme templates and use various applications and softwares to make memes.
5. Judging criteria - Judging will be based on the basis of
a. Reach of post - 20%
b. Reactions on Post - 30%
c. Content Quality - 50%
Further details on Reactions
Like/Reaction - 1 points
Comment on post - 2 points
Share - 3 Points
The content quality will be assessed by a panel of judges, and their verdict will be final! 
6. Competition Deadline ( extended ) : 6 November, 2019 at 10:00 PM.
Send your entries to the person enlisted, with your details (Name, Roll no, Year, Branch)
Kabir Agarwal 
Whatsapp - +91-8800000836
Email - taas.astronomers@gmail.com
Who is Mamta Mam?

Designation:
Assistant Professor
Specialization:
Astronomy and Astrophysics, Gravitational Dynamics
Email:
mamta.gulati@thapar.edu
Biography
Dr. Mamta Gulati is currently working as an Assistant Professor at School of Mathematics, Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala. She joined the dapartment in July 2017. She completed her doctorate from Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bangalore in 2014 and then joined Indian Institute of Science Education and Research Mohali (IISER Mohali) as a Post Doctoral Fellow for 2-years. Thereafter she was working as a Research Assosiate at IISER Mohali under SERB-DST project (NPDF Fellow). Her research interests are in Astronomy and Astrophysics, Gravitaional Dynamics. She is also actively involved in teaching at various levels at the Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology.

Education
Ph.D., IISc Bangalore, India, Astronomy and Astrophysics
M. Sc. Mathematics, Panjab University, Chandigarh, India
B. Sc (Mathematics Honours), Govt. College for Women, Ludhiana, Punjab, India
Experience: More than 5 years of Post Ph.d. experience
Teaching: Teaching Faculty at Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology from July 2017 to present.
Research: Research Associate at IISER Mohali from July 2014 to June 2017 (Institute fellow for two years and DST-SERB NPDF fellow for one year).
Research Projects:
Title: A Study of different aspects of galaxy evolution.
Period: July 2016 to July 2017.
Summary: Disc galaxies are quiet commonly seen astronomical objects in universe. Evolution of galaxies is known to be affected by various processes. In this work we studied the long term effects on the evolution of disc galaxies when it passes through the intergalactic medium (IGM), in particular the effect on the gas component of the disc. Ram pressure stripping (RPS) of gas from the disc as it passes through the IGM, is known to be the dominant process to remove gas from the discs. However a systematic study of such system was lacking. We propose a model for RPS on galaxy evolution and address the questions like: how gas is stripped as it passes through the intergalactic medium, what are its effects on the evolution of star formation rate and the effect of RPS as a function of galaxy mass.
Funding Agency/Amount: Science and Engineering Research Board (DST)/INR 19.2 Lac.
Description of Research Interests:
Her research interests mainly lies in Gravitational dynamics. Most of her work is based on the study of slow modes for various astrophysically relevant discs. These modes are suspected to be the reason behind various structures observed in these discs, which inturn are correlated to the global properties of discs.
 
Publications:
Journals

Membership of Professional Institutions, Associations, Societies
Achievement, Awards and Recognitions
Message to Students & Community
Always Believe in 3-D’s: Direction, Dedication and Discipline .

RAM pressure stripping: an analytical approach, Ankit Singh, Mamta Gulati, Tarun Deep Saini; Mon. Not. R. Astron. Soc., 489, 5582-5593 (2019) (arXiv:1909.02744).
Modal analysis of gravitational instabilities in nearly Keplerian, counter-rotating collisionless discs, Mamta Gulati, Tarun Deep Saini; Mon. Not. R. Astron. Soc., 465, 2505-2516 (2017) (arXiv:1602.07169).
A modified WKB formulation for linear eigenmodes of a collisionless self-gravitating disc in the epicyclic approximation, Mamta Gulati, Tarun Deep Saini; Mon. Not. R. Astron. Soc., 460, 1019-1032 (2016) (arXiv:1601.04148).
Unstable m = 1 modes of counter-rotating Keplerian discs, Mamta Gulati, Tarun Deep Saini, S. Sridhar; Mon.Not. R. Astron. Soc. 424, 348-360 (2012) (arXiv:1203.2239).
Slow pressure modes in thin accretion discs, Tarun Deep Saini, Mamta Gulati, S. Sridhar; Mon. Not. R. Astron.Soc. 400, 2090-2097 (2009) (arXiv:0901.4229).
Visiting Associate at Inter-University Center for Astronomy and Astrophysics, Pune, India.
Life member of Astronomical Society of India.
DST National Postdoctroral Fellowship, Hosted at Indian Institute of Science Education and Research, Mohali, Punjab (July, 2016-July, 2017).
Post Doctoral Fellowship (Institute supported) at Indian Institute of Science Education and Research, Mohali, Punjab (July, 2014-June, 2016).
Received Junior Research Fellowship (August,2007-July, 2009) and Senior Research Fellowship (July, 2009-April, 2014) to pursue graduate studies at Indian Institute of Science and Raman Research Institute.
Received National Board of Higher Mathematics (NBHM) scholarship for two years (2005-2007) during M.Sc.
Qualified GATE in March, 2007, (All India Rank-103).

Wat was CHANDRAYAAN III LAUNCHING LIVE SCREENING?

START DATE: 14th July 2023 		END DATE: 14th July 2023
VENUE: Ramanujan Seminar Hall (G block 303)
NUMBER OF THE MEMBERS IN THE ORGANIZING TEAM: 30
NUMBER OF THE PARTICIPANTS: 450+
DESCRIPTION OF THE EVENT:
As the emerging leaders of space technology and research, Indian Research Space Organization (ISRO) has been a constant source of pride for every Indian across the world. Successfully launching the Chandrayaan 3 mission- the third lunar mission of ISRO- from Satish Dhawan Space Center, Sriharikota, Andhra Pradesh, on 14th July 2023 at 2:35 pm, the achievement was a monumental moment that held the breath of every person watching. Thapar Amateur Astronomers' Society organized a live screening of the launch, as over 450 students and faculty gathered in the room to watch the moment. As astronomy enthusiasts, we aided in making everyone understand the scientific and technical aspects behind the process of launch to help in increasing their understanding of the feat. The witnessing of such a moment is sure to inspire many people, and add to their comprehension of the cosmos and the science that would take us to step beyond previously imagined limits.
Wat was SOCIETY FAIR of 2023 for taas?

START DATE: 21st August 2023 		END DATE: 21st August 2023
VENUE: Fete Area
NUMBER OF THE MEMBERS IN THE ORGANIZING TEAM: 23
NUMBER OF THE PARTICIPANTS: 800
DESCRIPTION OF THE EVENT:
A warm introduction of all the societies is customary to the newly arrived first years, conducted with the intention of helping them find a suitable society that fits their interest and passion as well as making the fair a fun experience. Thapar Amateur Astronomers’ Society (TAAS) set up a stall- numbered 46- which involved astronomy related quizzes and games. We hosted “Drop the Ball”- an astronomy themed, luck based game, which branched out into a game of dare, quiz and prizes, “Flip the Rocket”- a simple game of flipping the rocket and making it land straight up and a video game- “Space Invaders” made by the members of TAAS, which revolved around defending the spaceship and shooting down aliens that attacked. The newly arrived freshers enjoyed the experience, taking bookmarks, stickers and posters as souvenirs.
Wat was CHANDRAYAAN III LANDING LIVE SCREENING?

START DATE: 23rd August 2023		END DATE: 23rd August 2023
VENUE: LP-104
NUMBER OF THE MEMBERS IN THE ORGANIZING TEAM: 23
NUMBER OF THE PARTICIPANTS: 500+
DESCRIPTION OF THE EVENT:

On August 23, 2023, the Thapar Amateur Astronomers Society (TAAS) hosted a live screening of the Chandrayaan-3 landing. The event was initially scheduled to be held in LP 104, but due to overwhelming student interest, it was also held in LT 103. 
The TAAS team moderated a crowd of approximately 500 people, including students and faculty. The students watched the live screening with enthusiasm, and the entire crowd held their breaths during the final countdown.

As everyone watched the Vikram Lander successfully touch down near the south pole of the lunar surface, the crowd erupted in patriotic pride and chants of "Vande Mataram." It was truly a magnificent moment, as everyone got to watch India make history together and become the first nation to achieve this enormous feat. 

After the live screening, the Vice President of TAAS, Mrs. Mamta Gulati addressed the crowd. As it is our aim to help people in understanding the complexity of science and the astronomy, we hosted a short quiz regarding the Chandrayaan-3 to encourage the curiosity of the crowd and increase their knowledge. The winners were then awarded with stickers and bookmarks.
Wat was ORIENTATION like for taas in 2023?

START DATE: 3rd September 2023		END DATE: 3rd September 2023
VENUE: C-Hall
NUMBER OF THE MEMBERS IN THE ORGANIZING TEAM: 23
NUMBER OF THE PARTICIPANTS: Around 200
DESCRIPTION OF THE EVENT:

The Thapar Amateur Astronomers Society (TAAS) hosted its Orientation for the '26 and '27 batches, introducing students to the society and igniting their passion for astronomy. With all space enthusiasts gathered together, the atmosphere was brimming with anticipation. 

TAAS team conducted workshops, informative lectures and quizzes which kept students engaged throughout the orientation. Students also had the opportunity to learn about TAAS's flagship events and activities like watch parties and telescope setups, all of which boosted the enthusiasm in them. 

As an extra layer of excitement, students who won the astronomy quiz were rewarded with awards. Towards the conclusion of the event, students were invited to share their heartfelt thoughts and experiences related to astronomy. The orientation concluded with a profoundly inspiring and informative speech by the professor Dr. Debabrata Deb, leaving the students even more passionate and motivated about astronomy.
Wat is PICTIONARY and it happened when?

START DATE: 17th October 2023		END DATE: 17th October 2023
VENUE: T-205
NUMBER OF THE MEMBERS IN THE ORGANIZING TEAM: 23
NUMBER OF THE PARTICIPANTS: 85
DESCRIPTION OF THE EVENT:

TAAS team conducted the Pictionary event, a team based intra-TAAS event designed to cultivate teamwork and co-ordination among the newly recruited members. This inter-TAAS activity featured teams pitting their wits and artistic talents against each other in a captivating Astronomy Skribble game.

Each team will give another team an astronomy word and one of the members of that team will have to draw the description of that word. If their team guesses the word correctly, they get points. The competition concluded after four intense rounds, with both teams emerging as joint winners due to their equal points. 

The venue buzzed with contagious enthusiasm and a competitive spirit, as almost the entire team was present. Team members engaged in lively interactions, pooling their knowledge to collaboratively unravel answers. The students thoroughly enjoyed the experience, creating a vibrant atmosphere.
DId TAAS organized some kind of movie night on halloween

YES! START DATE: 31st October 2023		END DATE: 31st October 2023
VENUE: TAN AUDI
NUMBER OF THE MEMBERS IN THE ORGANIZING TEAM: 23
NUMBER OF THE PARTICIPANTS: 350+
DESCRIPTION OF THE EVENT:

To celebrate the wonderful evening that lies in the middle of September Equinox and the Winter solstice, Thapar Amateur astronomy society sought to bring together an unforgettable experience for all the geeks and nerds of Thapar Institute. 

Together we transformed the Tan Auditorium into a fun filled manor filled with props and decorations from everybody's favourite TV shows, games and movies. An overwhelming 350+ people were in our audience and we were excited to see a multitude of them dressed as their favourite characters and wearing various costumes and accessories in the spirit of the event. Owing to that anticipation, our "Mugshot" photo booth was a jailbreaking success capturing several suspicious looking people in costumes.

For the movie screening we presented a blockbuster science fiction thriller film named the "Ender's Game" adapted from one of the best selling military science fiction novel of the same name written by Orson Scott Card in 1985. To conclude the evening we hosted a best costume competition where the winners were chosen by the audience. 

Everybody was delighted to receive delicious and enchanting custom chocolates and cakes which were themed especially for our event as refreshments. TAAS is considerate towards the environment and did its best to keep the waste to a minimum. We prioritize a smooth sailing and enjoyable experience for all; Cleanliness and decorum were thusly maintained.

What is the vision of TAAS?

Our Vision
Explore The Cosmos with Science and Engineering
We are a group of Amateur Astronomers majorly consisting of students and some interested and equally passionate faculty members that love Astronomy and Cosmology. We are bunch of nerds that love to discuss all things space, the physics and math of the universe, it's implications and acquiring knowledge along the way that we can share with people like us.

We believe that rationale, logic and thinking should be the governing principles of one's life and they help lead provide purpose and meaning.
What are the objectives of TAAS?

Our Objectives
To help cultivate a scientific temperament and rationale in young minds.

To encourage people

To create a platform for students who are interested in applying their knowledge and skills in the field of Astronomy, Astrophysics and Cosmology

To open up opportunities for students willing to work as Professionals in the subject.
